definition: know yourself, know your enemy (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
to know/to be aware
self/oneself/sixth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/sixth in order/letter "F" or Roman "VI" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/hexa
to know/to be aware
that/those/(one) another
know yourself and know your enemy, and you will never be defeated (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
pinyin: zhi1 ji3 zhi1 bi3 , bai3 zhan4 bu4 dai4

sentences.english: Su and Wen are cousins with an age difference of twenty-two years.
sentences.chinese: 兩人爲相差二十二歲之表兄弟，情真意切，知己知彼。

sentences.english: Knowing oneself and each other is an important prerequisite for cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 知己知彼是合作的重要前提。

sentences.english: The old adage 'know you enemy' is an appropriate analogy here.
sentences.chinese: 有句諺語，“知己知彼”就是這個道理吧。

definition: to come unscathed through a hundred battles (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3]); to win every fight
know yourself and know your enemy, and you will never be defeated (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
pinyin: zhi1 ji3 zhi1 bi3 , bai3 zhan4 bu4 dai4

definition: to know the enemy and know oneself (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War")
to emerge victorious in every battle/to be ever-victorious
to catch an enemy off guard with a surprise attack (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
pinyin: chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4

definition: lit. before it rains, bind around with silk (idiom, from Book of Songs 詩經|诗经); fig. to plan ahead/to prepare for a rainy day
there can never be too much deception in war/in war nothing is too deceitful/all's fair in war
Preparedness averts peril./to be prepared, just in case (idiom)
to win by a surprise move
to advance gradually and entrench oneself at every step/to consolidate at every step
to know what's going on
clear as a flame (idiom); to see things absolutely clearly
an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
pinyin: dang1 ju2 zhe3 mi2 , pang2 guan1 zhe3 qing1

definition: to suss out/to figure out/to ascertain
no arrogance in victory, no despair in defeat
pinyin: sheng4 bu4 jiao1 , bai4 bu4 nei3

definition: an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
